2025-09-24.content: Support for setting multiple environment variables using the `.env` file is in General Availability (GA). For more information, see [Configure environment variables for services](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/environment-variables.md#set_multiple_environment_variables), [jobs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/jobs/environment-variables.md#set_multiple_environment_variables), and [worker pools](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/workerpools/environment-variables.md#set_multiple_environment_variables).

summary.title: Multiple environment variables now supported
summary.summary: You can now set multiple environment variables using a .env file for Cloud Run services, jobs, and worker pools. This feature is now in General Availability.

2025-09-23.content: You can specify mount options when you configure Cloud Storage volume mounts for Cloud Run [services](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/cloud-storage-volume-mounts), [jobs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/jobs/cloud-storage-volume-mounts), and [worker pools](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/workerpools/cloud-storage-volume-mounts). (GA)

summary.title: Cloud Run volume mounts now support mount options
summary.summary: You can now specify mount options when configuring Cloud Storage volume mounts for Cloud Run services, jobs, and worker pools.

2025-09-10.content: You can deploy and configure a [multi-region service](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/multiple-regions#deploy) from a single gcloud CLI command or by using a YAML or Terraform file (GA).

summary.title: Deploy multi-region service
summary.summary: Deploy and configure a multi-region service using a single gcloud CLI command or YAML/Terraform files.

summary.title: Cloud Run Threat Detection Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Cloud Run Threat Detection is now available in General Availability. This feature helps secure your Cloud Run services.

2025-09-03.content: You can [configure GPU](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/workerpools/gpu) in your Cloud Run worker pool (Preview).

summary.title: GPU support in Cloud Run worker pools
summary.summary: You can now configure GPUs in your Cloud Run worker pools. This feature is currently in Preview.

summary.title: Go 1.25 runtime now available on Cloud Run
summary.summary: Go 1.25 runtime now available.

2025-08-20.content: For Cloud Run source deployed services and functions with [GPU enabled](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/gpu), Cloud Run defaults to using Cloud Build's `e2-highcpu-8` machine type for the build process when you use the `gcloud beta run` command (Preview). This change allows for higher CPU support and faster build times, and also leads to a moderate increase in the overall cost of your service.

summary.title: Cloud Run GPU Build Enhancement
summary.summary: Cloud Run now uses e2-highcpu-8 for GPU builds with gcloud beta run.

2025-08-14.content:
The Python buildpack supports Cloud Run source deployments for modern web frameworks such as [FastAPI](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/quickstarts/build-and-deploy/deploy-python-fastapi-service.md), [Gradio](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/quickstarts/build-and-deploy/deploy-python-gradio-service), and [Streamlit](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/quickstarts/build-and-deploy/deploy-python-streamlit-service).

For Python version 3.13 and later, the Python buildpack sets the default entrypoint for [Cloud Run source deployments](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/deploying-source-code) based on the web server or framework configuration in your `requirements.txt` file. For more information, see [Build a Python application](https://cloud.google.com/docs/buildpacks/python#entrypoint).

summary.title: Python Buildpack Update
summary.summary: New buildpack for Python supports Cloud Run source deployments with modern web frameworks.

2025-08-13.content: You can set multiple environment variables using the `.env` file (Preview). For more information, see [Configure environment variables for services](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/environment-variables.md#set_multiple_environment_variables), [jobs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/jobs/environment-variables.md#set_multiple_environment_variables), and [worker pools](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/workerpools/environment-variables.md#set_multiple_environment_variables).

summary.title: New feature: Set multiple environment variables
summary.summary: Set multiple environment variables using the .env file.

2025-08-05.content: Support for [manually scaling your Cloud Run service](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/manual-scaling) is now at General Availability (GA).

summary.title: Cloud Run Manual Scaling GA
summary.summary: Manually scale your Cloud Run service.

summary.title: Go 1.24 runtime now available
summary.summary: Go 1.24 runtime now available.

2025-07-30.content: Support for [Go 1.25 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#go) is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products?e=48754805&hl=en#product-launch-stages). This runtime is available for early testers using existing [release candidates](https://go.dev/dl/#unstable).

summary.title: Go 1.25 runtime now in preview
summary.summary: Go 1.25 runtime now in preview. Early testers can use existing release candidates.

2025-07-30.content: Support for [Node.js 24 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#node.js) is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products?e=48754805&hl=en#product-launch-stages). Node.js 24 is in the Current release state and enters long-term support (LTS) in October 2025. For more information, see [Node.js v24.0.0 (Current)](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v24.0.0) in the Node.js website.

summary.title: Node.js 24 runtime now available
summary.summary: Node.js 24 runtime now in preview.

2025-07-16.content: You can [disable the built-in `run.app` URL](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/ingress) of a Cloud Run service to ensure that traffic can only ingress through paths that you've explicitly configured ([GA](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)).

summary.title: Cloud Run: Disable built-in `run.app` URL
summary.summary: You can now disable the built-in `run.app` URL for your Cloud Run services. This allows you to control traffic ingress more granularly, ensuring it only passes through your configured paths. This feature is now generally available.

2025-07-15.content:
Compute flexible committed use discounts (CUDs) have expanded to also cover your Cloud Billing account's spend across Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions.

The [improved spend-based CUD experience](https://cloud.google.com/docs/cuds-multiprice) is available without requiring an opt-in for new users or users who don't have an active spend-based CUD.

To learn more about how opting into the new model affects your flexible CUDs, see [Committed use discounts](https://cloud.google.com/run/cud).

summary.title: Flexible CUDs now cover Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now use flexible committed use discounts to cover your Cloud Billing account's spend on Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions. This feature is automatically available for new users and those without active spend-based CUDs.

summary.title: Go 1.24 runtime support in preview
summary.summary: Google Cloud Run now supports the Go 1.24 runtime in preview. This update allows developers to leverage the latest features and improvements in the Go programming language for their serverless applications.

2025-06-30.content: You can [apply maximum instance configuration](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/max-instances#service-vs-revision-level) at the service level (in Preview).

summary.title: Maximum instance configuration at service level
summary.summary: You can now set the maximum instance configuration at the service level. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-06-25.content: Cloud Run [worker pools](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/deploy-worker-pools) are now available (Preview). Worker pools are specifically designed for non-request workloads.

summary.title: Cloud Run worker pools now available in preview
summary.summary: Cloud Run worker pools are now available in preview. This feature is designed for non-request driven workloads.

2025-06-24.content: A new region is now available for [Cloud Run GPUs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/services/gpu#supported-regions): `us-east4`.

summary.title: New region available for Cloud Run GPUs
summary.summary: A new region, us-east4, is now available for Cloud Run GPUs.

2025-06-17.content: Support for the [PHP 8.4 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#php) is in [General Availability (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/?_gl=1*dplot*_ga*MTM2MDk5MzEzMi4xNzQ1ODg0OTY5*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTc0NjE0MTA3Ny4yMi4xLjE3NDYxNDEwOTYuMC4wLjA.#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: PHP 8.4 runtime now available on Cloud Run
summary.summary: PHP 8.4 runtime is now generally available on Google Cloud Run, offering enhanced features and performance for your applications.

2025-06-17.content: Support for the [Ruby 3.4 runtime](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtime-support#ruby) is in [General Availability (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/?_gl=1*dplot*_ga*MTM2MDk5MzEzMi4xNzQ1ODg0OTY5*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTc0NjE0MTA3Ny4yMi4xLjE3NDYxNDEwOTYuMC4wLjA.#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Ruby 3.4 runtime now available
summary.summary: Ruby 3.4 runtime is now generally available in Google Cloud Run, offering improved performance and features.

2025-06-16.content: You can [configure GPU](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/jobs/gpu) in your Cloud Run job (Preview).

summary.title: Configure GPU in Cloud Run Jobs
summary.summary: You can now configure GPUs in your Cloud Run jobs to run even more demanding workloads.

2025-06-09.content: You can [use request host and request path in IAM Conditions](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/managing-access#conditions) when defining access control for invoking Cloud Run services.

summary.title: IAM Conditions for Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now use request host and request path in IAM Conditions to manage access control for your Cloud Run services. This provides more granular control over who can invoke your services.

2025-05-30.content:
For Java Cloud Run functions that use `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 or later, you
can now use the logging class `java.util.logging.Logger` to add a [unique execution
ID](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/runtimes/java#execution_id) to log outputs.

summary.title: Execution ID logging for Java Cloud Run
summary.summary: You can now add a unique execution ID to your Java Cloud Run function logs using the `java.util.logging.Logger` class. This feature is available for functions using `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 and later.

2025-05-28.content: Multiple regions now benefit from enhanced responsiveness for latency-sensitive applications for [Cloud Run service URLs](https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/triggering/https-request#url).

summary.title: Enhanced Responsiveness for Cloud Run Service URLs
summary.summary: Latency-sensitive applications using Cloud Run service URLs now have improved responsiveness across multiple regions.
